result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Acknowledgement by Bail Depositor
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

1:54 PM Room 203 Defendant Charles H. West appeared by video, in custody of LCSD.  Attorney Kelly L Hays appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. Court calls case 20CF311 and case 22CF90 together and reviews. $5,000 current bond with conditions for case 22CF113 and $5,000 current bond with conditions for case 20CF311. Defendant gives bail bond argument. The Court questions ADA. ADA gives bail bond argument and objects. Defendant gives response. Court gives ruling. Court denies bail bond request modification. Bond remains with conditions. The Court makes statement. Status Conference previously scheduled. Court recesses at 2:04 PM.
regarding bond

bond reduction
Routed to Judge's JA
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Court calls 20CF113 @ 10:38 AM. Defendant Charles H. West appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of bail/bond and reviewed. Def. heard on request on 22CF90.  Defendant filed bond modification request on both cases.  Court now calls 22CF90. Def. heard on bail/bond modification. Court questions missed court dates. Def. explains why missed court. Court questions what kind of treatment.  Def. replies.  Court questions how much defendant can post and where would def. reside/work. Def. gives name and address of who will be residing with.  Def. is unsure RE: attorney rights. State objects to bail/bond modification. Def. heard on plea and sentencing and PSI.  Def. is planning to move forward with plea.  Court explains how a PSI is ordered. Court denies bail/bond modification. Court will revisit on the 30th RE: bond modification. ADA did give defendant an offer, and def. did accept offer. Court adjourns @ 10:50 am.
for bail reduction (Routed to Judge's JA)

01:59 PM in Room 203. Defendant Charles H. West in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles H. West appeared by video/Zoom means. 22CF90 and 20CF113. Court reviews history of case. State has sent an offer to Def. Def. has received. Court gives options. Def. has made counter-offer. State has not received. STC to be set. Def. makes argument as to bond reduction. State objects. Response by Def. The Court will keep bond as is. Court reserves right to revisit bond issue.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
SPD Status of Counsel Report

1:07 PM in Room 301. Defendant Charles H. West in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles H. West appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom. 20CF113 and 22CF90. Court reviews history of cases. Def wants to waive attny. Court reviews waiver of attny. Def. understands charges and possible penalties. Court finds Def. has waived attny, finds competent and will allow to represent self. Waiver of P.H. already held in 20CF113. P.H. rights given in 22CF90. Def. wants to waive time limits for P.H. Court accepts waiver of time limits for P.H.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls 22CF90 & 20CF113 @ 03:29 PM Defendant Charles H. West in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles H. West appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom.  Def. would like to waive attorney right. Bond continues  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court calls 22CF90, & 20CF113 @03:05 PM Defendant Charles H. West in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles H. West appeared by video means, via zoom.  Court review history of case. Def. wants to continue to wait for atty to be appointed. Court finds good cause to go past time limit for p.h. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bail/Bond

Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No driving without a valid driver's license. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

01:38 PM in Room 203. Defendant Charles H. West in court, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles H. West appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom. 22CF90 and 20CF113.  Initial in 22CF90 and 20CF113 is tracking. Def. advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. wants attny; Def. directed to contact PD. This is not a victim rights case. State heard on bond, recommends $5,000 cash with conditions he maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, no driving without a valid driver's license and no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Def. heard on bond. The Court orders $5,000 cash bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm. 20CF113 to track.
